title: Back at the Art Studio
logline: Jason returns to his studio in a panic, contacts Randal, and learns the devastating truth: the entire commission deal — including the cash — is fake.

setting.environment: Quiet night, studio lights dim except for artwork spots.

JASON_TOWNE.objective: Confirm whether he is being scammed and decide what to do about the commission.

STACEY.objective: Support Jason while navigating unclear loyalties.

RANDAL.objective: Warn Jason without revealing his own involvement.

KENNY.objective: Help Jason get his painting back.

story_beats.description: Jason and Stacey arrive at the studio; Jason is pacing and agitated.
Jason texts Randal, hoping he’s awake despite the time difference.
Randal FaceTimes Jason and confirms the scam mirrors Jason’s situation.
Randal reveals the cash is prop money, based on the contract spelling 'ca$h.'
Jason realizes the entire deal is fraudulent and suspects Stacey temporarily.
Jason decides he needs to steal his own painting back.
Jason calls Kenny for help, who enthusiastically agrees.

dialogue.line: I have to talk to this guy.
(Text) Hi Randal. We have a mutual artist friend who just told me about a scam you were involved in. I think I’m being scammed by the same people. Do you have time to talk?
Hey, what’s your name?
I’m Jason, we’re both friends with Mary Rios.
Okay, so you’re getting scammed?
I don’t know. I hope not. What happened to you?
They offered me a pile of cash. Lots of it.
Shit! That’s what’s happening to me… But I have the cash. What’s the scam part?
They offered fifty grand to anyone who stole my painting.
Same here! They just announced the same thing tonight!
You think the cash saved you.
Yeah. I have their money.
Oh, you think that cash is real?
Yeah.
It’s not real money. It’s prop ca$h.
No fucking way! It’s fake?
Look at your contract. They spell cash with a money symbol. That’s the trademark for a prop ca$h company.
I thought they were just being creative.
Fucking assholes! I don’t understand this scam!
I can’t say.
You can’t say, or you won’t say?
This is all news to me too. I can’t imagine we’d get scammed by someone who’d want video evidence of it.
Good point… I just don’t feel good about this deal anymore.
I know what has to be done! I’m going to take my painting back. You’re gunna scam me? Fuck you!
Sweet! You want the fifty grand?
No — it’s a scam. Everything is fake.
